verses.kjv: Let as many servants as are under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God and his doctrine be not blasphemed.
verses.ct: All who are slaves should give their masters complete respect, so that God's name and his teaching are not spoken against.

verses.kjv: And they that have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren; but rather do them service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.
verses.ct: Those who have masters who are believers should not show them less respect just because they are brothers. Instead, they should serve them even better, since the ones benefiting from their service are believers and loved by God. Teach and encourage these things.

verses.kjv: If any man teach otherwise, and consent not to wholesome words, even the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness;
verses.ct: If anyone teaches something different and does not agree with the sound words of our Lord Jesus Christ and the teaching that leads to godliness,

verses.kjv: He is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,
verses.ct: that person is arrogant and understands nothing. They have an unhealthy obsession with arguments and debates over words, which produce envy, conflict, insults, and evil suspicions,

verses.kjv: Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.
verses.ct: along with constant friction among people whose minds are corrupted and who have lost the truth. They think that godliness is a way to make money. Stay away from people like that.

verses.kjv: But godliness with contentment is great gain.
verses.ct: But godliness combined with contentment is tremendous gain.

verses.kjv: For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out.
verses.ct: We brought nothing into this world, and we certainly cannot take anything out of it.

verses.kjv: And having food and raiment let us be therewith content.
verses.ct: So if we have food and clothing, we should be satisfied with that.

verses.kjv: But they that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many foolish and hurtful lusts, which drown men in destruction and perdition.
verses.ct: But those who are determined to get rich fall into temptation and a trap, and into many foolish and harmful desires that plunge people into ruin and destruction.

verses.kjv: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
verses.ct: The love of money is the root of all kinds of evil. By chasing after it, some have wandered away from the faith and stabbed themselves with many sorrows.

verses.kjv: But thou, O man of God, flee these things; and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.
verses.ct: But you, as a man of God, run from these things. Instead, pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, endurance, and gentleness.

verses.kjv: Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.
verses.ct: Fight the good fight of faith. Take hold of eternal life, which you were called to and which you publicly declared before many witnesses.

verses.kjv: I give thee charge in the sight of God, who quickeneth all things, and before Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate witnessed a good confession;
verses.ct: I command you in the presence of God, who gives life to all things, and of Christ Jesus, who gave his bold testimony before Pontius Pilate:

verses.kjv: That thou keep this commandment without spot, unrebukeable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ:
verses.ct: Obey this command without fault or blame until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,

verses.kjv: Which in his times he shall shew, who is the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;
verses.ct: which God will bring about at the right time â€” he who is the blessed and only Ruler, the King of kings and Lord of lords,

verses.kjv: Who only hath immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto; whom no man hath seen, nor can see: to whom be honour and power everlasting. Amen.
verses.ct: who alone possesses immortality and lives in light so brilliant that no one can approach it. No one has ever seen him, and no one can see him. To him belong honor and eternal power. Amen.

verses.kjv: Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy;
verses.ct: Instruct those who are rich in this present age not to be arrogant or to place their hope in wealth, which is so uncertain. Instead, they should place their hope in the living God, who generously provides us with everything to enjoy.

verses.kjv: That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate;
verses.ct: Tell them to do good, to be rich in good deeds, to be generous, and to be willing to share.

verses.kjv: Laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.
verses.ct: By doing this, they are storing up for themselves a solid foundation for the future, so that they may take hold of the life that is truly life.

verses.kjv: O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding profane and vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called:
verses.ct: Timothy, guard what has been entrusted to you. Avoid godless, empty talk and the contradictions of what is falsely called knowledge,

verses.kjv: Which some professing have erred concerning the faith. Grace be with thee. Amen.
verses.ct: which some have claimed to have, and in doing so have strayed from the faith. Grace be with you. Amen.
